job.title: Lead Full Stack Engineer
job.description:
MultiThreaded Engineering, UX and Design at Stitch Fix
At Stitch Fix, our goal is to help our customers look great and feel great about themselves by revolutionizing how people shop. In a time-starved world where shopping often feels overwhelming, our business connects customers to clothes they love. Whether it’s helping someone dress for success at a new job or taking the stress out of packing for a family vacation, we fix clients’ closets – and they love us for it!
We’ve built unique, innovative software for merchandising, warehouse and inventory management, remote styling, and logistics. We leverage vast amounts of client data to make decisions throughout the company. All of this results in a simple, powerful offering to our clients and a very successful business. We believe we are only scratching the surface of our opportunity, and we’re looking for incredible people to contribute!
Lead Full Stack Engineer – Personalized Shop
Stitch Fix has thrived by correctly guessing what items match the wants and needs of our millions of clients using our “fix” subscription service. We are now investing in bringing our personalization power to build a better online shopping experience. With this Personalized Shop product offering, clients can leverage our data and recommendations to browse our available inventory and purchase items with confidence.
The Personalized Shop team is looking for a Lead Full Stack Engineer in our San Francisco office or remotely. As one of our lead engineers at Stitch Fix, you will work with product and technical stakeholders and other Personalized Shop engineers to design, break down, implement and ship user-facing features that empowers clients to purchase items they love directly from Stitch Fix, based on our personalized recommendations. You will help lead technical decision making, guiding the architecture of how we build new client experiences at Stitch Fix as well as provide thoughtful and careful feedback to other engineers on their implementations. We are a distributed team that operates in an agile-inspired manner; collaborating across 4 time zones.
About The Role
YOU….
4+ years of experience as a software engineer
Experience leading projects and working closely with Design and Product Management to define requirements
Hands-on experience with running modern web stacks (e.g. Node, React, Ruby on Rails, Postgres, GraphQL, Redis, Kafka).
You are bright, kind, and motivated by challenge
You have excellent analytical skills as well as communication skills both verbal and written.
You take initiative and operate with accountability.
You are motivated by solving problems and finding creative client-focused solutions.
Might have experience working remotely alongside a distributed software engineering team.
Might have experience with GraphQL schema design.
Might have experience with evolving a resilient distributed service architecture.
OUR TECHNOLOGY STACK...
React
TypeScript
JavaScript
GraphQL
Ruby and Rails
Postgres
Redis
Kafka
OUR TEAM….
Empowers clients to purchase items based on personalized recommendations
Enjoys a balance between pair-programming with our direct teammates and working independently
Operates in a remote-first environment, leveraging tools to bring us together
Partners closely with product management, designers, and data engineers
Delivers solutions that solve real business problems -- that frequently (not always) involve writing code
Collaborates with other engineering teams to build sensible software and systems
Is responsible for the ongoing health and maintenance of the apps we build
Reflects and iterates on our agile process to help us build better software
YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT STITCH FIX BECAUSE WE...
Are a group of bright, kind, and goal-oriented people
Are a successful, fast-growing company
Are a technologically and data-driven business
Are at the forefront of tech and fashion, redefining shopping for the next generation
Are passionate about our clients and live/breathe the client experience
Get to be creative every day
Have a smart, experienced, and diverse leadership team that wants to do it right & is open to new ideas
Believe in autonomy & taking initiative
Fully support remote work
Offer transparent, equitable, and competitive compensation based on your level to help eliminate bias in salaries, as well as equity and comprehensive health benefits
Are serious about our commitment to life-work balance, and have generous parental leave policies
About Stitch Fix
Stitch Fix is an online personal style service for men and women combining art and science to disrupt and redefine the retail industry. We’re the first fashion retailer to blend expert styling, proprietary technology, and unique product to deliver a refined and deeply personalized shopping experience. We leverage vast amounts of client data to make decisions throughout the company. All of this results in a simple, powerful offering to our customers and a successful, growing business. We believe we are only scratching the surface of our opportunity, and we’re looking for incredible people to contribute! We’d love for you to help us carry on the trend.
